definition: to be stupid/to cheat or deceive/me or I (modest)

sentences.english: Are we so uninformed about issues that we can be bought so easily?
sentences.chinese: 我们真的这么愚昧无知到不知道自己可以被轻易收买？

sentences.english: He is so simple minded that he does not know the whereabout of Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 他连北京在那里也不知道，他就是这样的愚昧无知。

sentences.english: Is this the return thou makest to the Lord, O foolish and senseless people?
sentences.chinese: 愚昧无知的人民，你们就这样报答上主吗？

sentences.english: Is the conviction of those to be in goodness, passion or ignorance?
sentences.chinese: 他们是具有善性品德，欲望情感还是愚昧无知呢？

sentences.english: Ignorance is the mother of impudence.
sentences.chinese: 厚颜无耻由于愚昧无知。

sentences.english: For my people is foolish, they have not known me;
sentences.chinese: 他们是愚昧无知的儿女。

sentences.english: Science has no enemy but the ignorant.
sentences.chinese: 科学的敌人是愚昧无知。

sentences.english: I was senseless and ignorant; I was a brute beast before you.
sentences.chinese: 我这样愚昧无知，在你面前如畜类一般。

sentences.english: So foolish was I, and ignorant: I was as a beast before thee.
sentences.chinese: 我这样愚昧无知，在你面前如畜类一般。

sentences.english: As a consequence, the country declined into poverty and ignorance.
sentences.chinese: 长期闭关自守，把中国搞得贫穷落后，愚昧无知。

sentences.english: We'll be talking about Milton's blindness.
sentences.chinese: 我们下次会说到弥尔顿的愚昧无知。

sentences.english: He drummed two injunctions into the mind of the ignorant.
sentences.chinese: 他向愚昧无知的人群谆谆教诲两条诫命。

definition: to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
ignorant masses/to keep the people in ignorance
not understanding things (idiom); devoid of sense
to think of oneself as terrific (idiom); arrogant
